member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextTemplating.VSHost.ProvideCodeGeneratorExtensionAttribute
member.summary: Attribute class to provide registration of a code generator against a specific file extension

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Modeling.SafeWindowTarget
member.summary:
Exception hardening work. This class can be used to filter messages sent to a control, and catch/display all non-critical exceptions. Otherwise, Watson will be invoked and will take down the process, potentially resulting in data loss. See document referenced in bug 427820 for more details. Use this class to wrap an existing IWindowTarget as follows (c is a Control):
c.WindowTarget = new SafeWindowTarget(c.WindowTarget);

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextTemplating.VSHost.TextTemplatingService.ExpandAllVariables(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the input string with any environment, VS macro variables, and project properties expanded.
member.remarks: Unrecognised variables are *not* removed as they could be filenames (both %test% and $(test) are valid file names. Macro variables are resolved after enviroment variables, so enviroment variables that contain macro variables will have those macro variables expanded. Variable are not expanded recursively by this method; recursive behavior is defined by the underlying APIs that the method calls. In the case of environment variables, this is Environment.ExpandEnvironmentVariables(...). This does not expand recursively.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextTemplating.VSHost.TextTemplatingService.ExpandEnvironmentVariables(System.String)
member.summary: Helper to consistently expand environment variables in a path.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextTemplating.VSHost.TextTemplatingService.ExpandVsMacroVariables(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the input string with any VS build macro variables replaced by the corresponding string value.
member.returns: The input string with any VS build macro variables replaced by the corresponding string value.
member.remarks: If buildMacroInfo is null, the input string will be returned unchanged. If a build macro cannot be resolved, it will not be replaced. Note that $(test).txt is a valid file name, so unrecognised macros will not be removed as they could be file names.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TextTemplating.VSHost.TextTemplatingService.ExpandProjectProperties(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the input string with any $(ProjectProperty) replaced with the actual value. Similar to Environment.ExpandEnvironmentVariables(), if ProjectProperty is not set, it will return the original value $(ProjectProperty). The replacement happens only in one pass, since a nested replacement would depend on the order of project properties.
